data.title: Missing Library: gdx-backend-lwjgl-native.jar always absent from new projects
data.body:
gradlew fails with:
- What went wrong:
  Execution failed for task ':tasks'.
  > Could not resolve all dependencies for configuration ':desktop:compile'.
  > Could not download artifact 'org.lwjgl.lwjgl:lwjgl-platform:2.9.1:lwjgl-platform-natives-windows.jar'
    > Artifact 'org.lwjgl.lwjgl:lwjgl-platform:2.9.1:lwjgl-platform-natives-windows.jar' not found.

And the library is not referenced in the eclipse desktop project causing it to fail at runtime.

data.title: "Tilde" or "Caret" key missing
data.body:
Hi devs!

In "com.badlogic.gdx.Input.Keys" I can not find the key which is located over the "Tab" key. On German keyboards it's the "Caret" and on English ones it's the "Tilde". Both are missing.

In the source I see that the line for Tilde is commented:
// public static final int TILDE = 0;

Is there a way to check if this key is pressed or how I can find out which int it needs so I can make a pull request after implementing it?

Cheers,
Benedikt

data.title: JSON issue with gdx-ai and cross references
Why not using putImageData in GWT's Pixmap?
data.body:
I notice that setting pixeldata in Pixmap is incredibly slow. I was wondering if there is a cause, and was looking through the source of Pixmap.

Now I'm not sure, but would using CanvasArray.set() for individual pixels and then context.putImageData() not be a lot faster, than the current solution?

data.title: TiledDrawable bug when desired width < width of one tile
data.body: TiledDrawable enforces the tile size at least once, which can be considered a bug.

data.title: Verifier rejected class Json
data.body:
I get this error on startup on Android with ART

``` java
java.lang.VerifyError: Verifier rejected class com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json due to bad method java.lang.String com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Json.toJson(java.lang.Object)
```

data.title: correct return value for IntFloatMap and IntIntMap getAndIncrement with 0 key
data.body: When calling IntFloatMap or IntIntMap getAndIncrement(..) with '0' key the returned value was not the value before increment but the value after.

data.title: Minor bug in generated Project
data.body:
Hi, 
this was my first time using the Project Generator, unfortunately with a small issue. I called the project "Demo". When I imported the project into eclipse it did NOT work instantly, because it couldn't find the asset. it turns out the link to the assets folder in "Demo-desktop" was not set correctly. it was "C:/.../workspace/core/assets" but should be "C:/.../workspace/Demo-core/assets". After this change, it works great!
Thanks to the whole team for this great software!
Phil

data.title: Wiki page on OrthographicCamera is out of date.
data.body:
The code samples on the following page no longer reflect the most recent version of LibGDX:
https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Orthographic-camera

Specifically, there is no "apply()" method on the OrthographicCamera class.

data.title: SelectBoxStyle.background is optional.
data.body: In that case the SelectBox background is transparent and user sees its parent actor background. Follows libgdx/libgdx#2250

data.title: correct path for 'working with the source' page
data.body: It looks like the 'Working with the Source' page was renamed when migrating to GitHub. This change correct the link (like in 'Contributing' page), but maybe its name should be corrected too.

data.title: 1280x720 fullscreen
data.body:
When setting width and height of a game on desktop to almost anything while also running in fullscreen, it works perfectly. The game get's streched across the whole screen. But when setting the resolution to 1280x720 while also fullscreen, the game get's streched so there are two horizontal stripes. That souldn't probably be happening. I have win8.1 with 1920x1080 monitor. I haven't tested it on other screens/platforms, but I can reproduce it.

Might be due monitor not supporting 1280x720, but when tested on some actuall games, it worked.

data.title: playbackDevice.writeSamples eating CPU
data.body:
On my system which is a 64-bit Linux box using Alsa for sound, the call to writeSamples on a AudioDevice maxes out a CPU core if the samplerate is 30khz (30000) or higher; however hardly any at all ( < 10% CPU) is used when the samplerate is 20khz (20000) or lower. 44.1khz and 48khz also maxes out a CPU.

Android seems to have no problem whatsoever.

data.title: Request: make Telegram.java constructor public
data.body:
libgdx / extensions / gdx-ai / src / com / badlogic / gdx / ai / msg / Telegram.java

hi,
can we make the constructor of Telegram.java public an give it some setters for the extraInfos?
that way we can use it as normal info-object to pass stuff to onMessage without having to use the messageDispatcher with its agents....

(in my case: i have a method called enterMenu(int menuID) .... i can extend the state-interface or use the Telegram and send it to onMessage with an int menuID.... but actually i cant create a Telegram ....

bye
phil

data.title: BOX2D: joint.WeldJointDef ( frequencyHz and DampingRatio) attributes are missing
data.body:
In the original Box2D API, the WeldJointDef class has two Attributes that I couldn't find in the LibGdx gdx.physics.box2d.joint.WeldJointDef class which are: 
- frequencyHz. 
- DampingRatio. 
  modifying these two attributes give more flexibility to the joint.

data.title: parsing error emitter with 2 or more emitters
data.body: Hi. When I create a .p file with the ParticleEditor with 3 emitters and load it in my project I had this error in my java console : "Exception in thread "LWJGL Application" java.lang.RuntimeException: Error parsing emitter: - Delay -" but if only 1 emitter it works fine !

Hello everyone, i don't know how to display a web page in Android app. I'm using Libgdx. Does Libgdx support it??
Thanks!

data.title: 3D particle effects gradient color multiplication.
data.body: Can be handy for 3D particles dynamic color modifications.

data.title: Scaling ModelInstance with Bullet and MotionState
Additional flag to fix DragAndDrop in ScrollPane
data.body:
I've noticed that it's not really possible to use `DragAndDrop` inside a `ScrollPane` currently. Since the scroll pane is higher in the hierarchy, it receives the touch down events before it could be handled by the `DragListener`. That's why usually a drag will start and after dragging the payload a little bit more, the scroll pane behaviour will kick in, scroll the pane and cancel the dragging.

I've added an additional flag which will enable users to cancel the touch focus for all other listeners, but the currently active `DragListener`, in case a successful drag event has begun (payload != null). I think this is better default behaviour, but I didn't want to change the current behaviour, so it's disabled by default.

data.title: FrameBuffer renders source image differently (Transparency/Alpha Problem)
data.body:
I try to render a stage into a Frame Buffer object and then use that as an exact replica of the rendered stage.

However, the result from the frame buffer shows a different colored/alpha'd image.

I tried out different Blend functions and searched through the topics about other people having similar issues but I could not come up with a way that does exactly what I would like to do.

Minimal example:
Top and bottom version of the picture shown should (ideally) look exactly the same.
http://pastebin.com/aT3XbqFK

Needed Picture: 
![highscoretable](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8322297/3943291/e10ae9ca-2595-11e4-874f-4997fbac6d0b.png)

Thank you very much for your help and efforts!

(This is how the minimal example should render:
![screenshot 2014-08-17 00 39 39](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8322297/3943295/6faf1606-2596-11e4-9f8a-83c5830cb57e.png)

data.body:
I was using the message dispatcher and I found having methods like these quite useful.

If they fall outside of the scope of the object please ignore

data.title: NetJavaImpl - getResult/getResultAsString
data.body:
The methods in the title alter their internal state such that you cannot call these methods multiple times and get sensible results (basically, it reads from a socket blindly and returns the result; the subsequent calls read from an empty socket).

This has made my app control flow a bit awkward, but more importantly, I had to dig into the code to figure this out. It's not documented anywhere and definitely goes against the norms and what I would expect.

I can alter my program flow to work around this no problem, but the oddity should be documented, or the functions should be callable multiple times.
